job_description:
Description
If you are a passionate practitioner of machine learning and artificial intelligence who does not shy away from using the latest tools and technology in the cloud, to push the boundaries of model building targeting the best in class industry-leading capabilities, this is the right job for you.


You are comfortable imagining a world where it takes six days or less versus six months to build, train, test, iterate, explain and deploy models into production working with both internal and external stakeholders. You take immense pride in your everyday work but have zero egos taking feedback and bringing teammates along the journey and you can balance model accuracy with human intuition and common sense.


Primary responsibilities include:
Driving transformation using machine learning, either working individually or in small groups.
Rolling up your sleeves and enabling the model building process from end-to-end managing stakeholders, presenting the results and helping the team grow in an agile organization.

Qualifications
Required Skills/Experience:
4 or more years of experience working in a data environment
At least 2 years of experience in Python, Scala or R
Demonstrated quick learner, highly analytical with excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and storytelling skills
Enjoys solving challenging problems in a fast-paced environment and participating in Kaggle competitions
Proven experience working on multiple projects involving programming and building predictive models using R or Python
Experience building and deploying machine learning algorithms such as Random Forest, Gradient Boosting and Neural Networks into production
Experience supporting multiple projects using Natural Language Processing and Text Analytics
Experience working in distributed computing technology such as HDFS, Spark MLib, and Mapreduce
Hand on experience with Amazon AWS machine learning technologies such as Amazon SageMaker, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Textract
Experience working with relational databases and data warehouse such as Amazon Redshift
Education, Certifications, and Other Professional Credentials:
Bachelors or Masters in computer science and or in a field such as statistics, mathematics, econometrics from a top-tier institution with a strong academic track record
Certifications in AWS and machine learning are preferred
Hours & Work Schedule


Hours per Week: 40
Work Schedule: Monday through Friday

At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

In this role you will serve as analytics liaison between business and technical teams to drive results and enhanced value though improved delivery of impactful analytic insights, improved data visualization and statistical analyses as part of an Enterprise-wide initiative.



The Advisor will work within a high-performing analytics team, using new technologies to develop and deliver solution-oriented products that drive innovation in our business.



The ideal candidate will have:



Business acumen and experience to generate customized, actionable insights in a data-driven and deadline-oriented environment



Strong computer science and quantitative skills to extract maximum value from CVS Health’s data assets



Hands-on business experience with statistical programming (SAS,R, Python) as well as advanced data science concepts (e.g., regression modeling, time-series forecasting, classification, data clustering, time series forecasting, advanced machine learning techniques).



A day in the life of this position involves:

Collaborating with other highly skilled analytics colleagues within Retail Pharmacy Enterprise Analytics team to derive business insights from our data assetsRapidly developing a deep understanding of CVS data and processes across multiple lines of business as well as serving as SME and data steward for others in the application and use of our dataDeveloping predictive models and machine learning algorithms to facilitate business growth and profitabilityPerforming ad-hoc analyses by innovatively segmenting product and store level data to unlock insights
- Structuring and executing against analytic road-maps to meet both short- and long-term needs of our business stakeholders

Diligently addressing obstacles as they appearDemonstrating your curiosity to learn about enterprise initiatives that include data and business intelligence solutionsSupporting the development and maintenance of data

#AnalyticsEA



Required Qualifications

Minimum of 5 years of experience delivering growth-oriented, quantitative solutions in retail or healthcare environments A \minimum of three years post graduate paid work experience coding in statistical packages e.g., (SAS, R, and Python) with strong quantitative skills, including relevant experience in logistic regression, cluster analysis, time series analysis, inferential statistics, and experimental design Minimum of two years processing large data sets (measured in hundreds of millions or billions of records) using data mining programs such as SQL Minimum of two years’ experience working with data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau and Microstrategy) Two years + knowledge from retail and/or healthcare industries Minimum of 2 years of experience building and facilitating presentations to various audiences: technical, non-technical and senior leaders



Preferred Qualifications

Leadership experience of large-scale analytics projects

Demonstrated competencies such as teamwork, creative problem solving, and flexibility

A strong curiosity to continuously learn data science techniques and tools

Ability to work within a climate of ambiguity

Strong personal organizational skills

Excellent relationship management, strong team building, and the ability to work across business units within a complex organization



Education

BA/BS in Mathematics/Statistics, Economics (or other quantitative disciplines); Master’s degree preferred



Business Overview

It’s a new day in health care.



Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.



We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.



CVS Health is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. Gender/Ethnicity/Disability/Protected Veteran – we highly value and are committed to all forms of diversity in the workplace. link: Director Data Science - Machine Learning/Artificial Intellig...
job_title: Director Data Science - Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence
job_description:
Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.



Our data science team is innovate, collaborate, and high-energy with a passion for data, attention to detail, and a positive attitude in development of the company's state-of-the-art, advanced analytical machine learning models, and optimization techniques to lead the transformation of our ExtraCare program into a world-class personalization and loyalty program. This is a team of experts in data science, machine learning, artificial intelligence, software engineering and responsible building the customer personalized engine and multi-level reward programs based on purchase preferences; conducting hands-on analysis on customer and campaign data and uncover insights in customer behavior and business profitability. With over 10,000 Retail locations and +70M active ExtraCare members this is a top initiative within the company and we have a team dedicated to recruiting the best talent in the world to help propel us to this goal. The company has invested in state-of-the-art cloud infrastructure and scaling of our loyalty program, now we are focused on optimizing how we communicate with our customers. We are looking for the best and brightest to add to our existing Analytics team and help deliver on this initiative.



The Director is responsible for growing and developing the data science team who analyze large data sets, build scalable and automated machine learning algorithms, and optimization techniques to implement analytical solutions. As CVS continues on its journey to deliver our customers’ 1:1 personalized experiences through multiple channels you will be a strong executor, as well as a technical authority interacting closely with business partners to understand the business goals, communicate vision and roadmap, and ensure delivery of relevant solutions for the business while growing a team culture of research, testing, learning and innovation. The director will have unique opportunity to work with massive business and the data generated by CVS's unparalleled online and offline systems for researching, and brainstorming with internal and external stakeholders applying the machine learning/artificial intelligence techniques including but not limited to, regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory, stochastic systems, Bayesian inference, statistical techniques, deep learning, supervised learning, and unsupervised learning to design and prototype robust and scalable analytical models.



Key Responsibilities

Design and build machine learning modules to implement predictive & prescriptive analytical solutions in areas such as customer loyalty prediction, customer personalized engine recommendations, customer segmentation and profiling, audience targeting, offer optimization, retention analysis, churn assessment, and product recommendationDesign and build personalization engines/learning systems that react to changes in customer preferences using advanced machine learning and statistical techniquesResearch and brainstorm with internal stakeholders to identify advanced analytics opportunities to advance automation, help with knowledge discovery, support decision-making, gain insights from data, streamline business processes, and enable new capabilitiesPerform hands-on data exploration and modeling work on massive data sets. Perform feature engineering, train the algorithms, back-test models, compare model performances and communicate the resultsEvaluate effectiveness of existing merchandising, marketing & promotional strategies and make recommendations for future optimizationWork with senior leaders from all functions to explore opportunities for using advance analyticsProvide technical leadership, coaching, and mentoring to talented data scientists and analytics professionalsGuide data scientists in the use of advanced statistical, machine learning, and artificial intelligence methodologiesGuide the work of other data scientists to provide support and assistance, while also ensuring qualityProvide thought leadership by researching best practices, extending and creating new machine learning and statistical methodologies, conducting experiments, and collaborating with cross functional teamsDevelop end-to-end efficient model solutions that drive measurable outcomes. Manage the model development lifecycle, including both working with data engineers and IT partners to identify what data are needed, and training the business end-users on how to leverage the modeling output


Required Qualifications

10+ Years of experience in solving complex business problems and delivering scalable data science/machine learning/artificial intelligence solutions as part of an automated pipeline6+ years leading large teams of Data Scientists and significant experience in hiring, building, coaching, and growing a team of data scientists and machine learning engineersExperienced in statistics & analytical modeling, time-series data analysis, forecasting modeling, machine learning algorithms, and deep learning approaches and frameworks. Have a proven track record of delivering robust, scale and quality data analytical applications in a cloud environment.
Minimum 5+ years of working knowledge and Demonstrated hands-on experience with machine learning stacks such as Python, R, Spark, Hadoop, AWS, AzureML, CUDA/GPUStrong working technical skills on machine learning/artificial intelligence. These technical skills include, but not limited to, regression techniques, neural networks, decision trees, clustering, pattern recognition, probability theory, stochastic systems, Bayesian inference, statistical techniques, deep learning, supervised learning, unsupervised learningSolid understanding and hands on experience working with big data, and the related ecosystem, both relational and unstructured.Demonstrated experience in executing on complex projects, extracting, cleansing, and manipulating large, diverse structured and unstructured data sets on relational - SQL, NOSQL databasesExperience working in an agile environment with iterative development & business feedbackExperience providing insights to support strategic decisions, including preparing and delivering insights and recommendationsComfortable with loosely defined requirements where you exercise your analytical skills to collaborate with the rest of the team to build solutionsExcellent problem-solving skills with ability to synthesize & communicate complex results to senior leaders. Attention to detail with focus on data quality, data consistency and criticalityAbility to shape ambiguity, govern & prioritize in a matrixed environment across organizational boundariesExcellent written and oral communication and presentation skills, with the ability to tailor the communication style to the right audience, from the analytic professional to executive leaders.


Preferred Qualifications

1. Management consulting experience a plus

2. Understanding of the healthcare administration landscape and CVS Health business model, ideally in customers’ 1:1 personalized experience and loyalty programs

3. Strong desire to stay ahead of industry trends & technologies with a commitment to continuous learning



Education

PhD in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or directly related field.



Business Overview

It’s a new day in health care.



Combining CVS Health and Aetna was a transformative moment for our company and our industry, establishing CVS Health as the nation’s premier health innovation company. Through our health services, insurance plans and community pharmacists, we’re pioneering a bold new approach to total health. As a CVS Health colleague, you’ll be at the center of it all.



We offer a diverse work experience that empowers colleagues for career success. In addition to skill and experience, we also seek to attract and retain colleagues whose beliefs and behaviors are in alignment with our core values of collaboration, innovation, caring, integrity and accountability.

link: Director/Squad Leader – Data and Cloud Innovation
job_title: Director/Squad Leader – Data and Cloud Innovation
job_description:
We are hiring an ambitious leader who is passionate about the strategic use of data to drive business results enabled by cloud based technologies. You represent the needs of our business unit helping to create a data driven culture by building out our data platforms to power our many Artificial Intelligence use cases. You will work closely with our Data Science team to identify, test and integrate new data sources to scale our Artificial Intelligence capabilities. You will also work closely with data architects and business leaders to evolve and execute our business centric data strategy and work to accelerate innovation using newly available cloud based data and analytic capabilities.



The Team

Your work will support the growth of Fidelity’s Institutional Asset Management (FIAM) business and help accelerate the significant momentum underway to become a data driven, AI enabled organization. FIAM is a sales, marketing and servicing division within Fidelity with the mission to bring Fidelity investment products and services to the market through investment advisors and large institutions. This is a dynamic environment that operates using mature agile practices and principles. It has a proven culture that fully uses data and analytics to capture competitive advantage. We stress client-obsessed thinking and creativity.


As Squad Leader, you are responsible for the What; the Why; and the Desired Outcome. You will be embedded in an agile squad and work directly with its members to prioritize and manage what needs to be done and by when. You won’t have direct reports. Working with your squad members is key – you are a servant leader and embody that in how you approach the work. You will coordinate closely with your Tribe Leader to stay aligned on business goals and make sure your squad is progressing and delivering business value against them. You will make sure all squad members understand the business context and value of each use case and you will maintain, prioritize and groom the backlog of stories that your squad works from.
The Squad Leader will serve as a key leader on an ongoing critical initiative to create a data driven culture using data, AI and analytic capabilities. You will:
Work to accelerate the migration of our existing data ecosystem to cloud based platforms.
Update and execute our data strategy and lead your squad implementing cross business unit use cases to enable FIAM to win in the marketplace with new products and services.
Identify and lead POC’s for promising new innovative capabilities to improve the speed of delivery and impact of use cases.
Develop coordinated roadmaps with other squad leaders aligning priorities and interdependencies.
Partner with the data science team to identify, test and integrate new innovative external and internal data sources to improve model performance.
Apply data governance standard methodologies to help associates find, understand and trust data as we scale our platforms
The Position is based out of Smithfield, RI
The Expertise You Have
Experience leading data centric initiatives – data savvy
Has a business value delivery attitude and a bias for action
Interested in AI concepts/approaches and cloud capabilities
Brings a data-driven approach to decision-making, both in day-to-day management and in making strategic trade-offs
Proven ability to partner across multiple squads and business units to develop coordinated approaches to use case delivery and planning
Is intellectually curious and loves learning new skills and capabilities, e.g., Agile principles and cloud technology platforms, AI concepts
Looks for opportunities to innovate and take thoughtful risks in order to get things done better and faster using a minimum viable product attitude.
BS/BA degree with 7+ years knowledge and experience working with various data related platforms, solutions and vendors, MBA a plus, or equivalent experience.
The Skills You Bring
Your strong intuition for business and a deep strategic attitude
Your experience working with and understanding the needs of business leaders and related partners
Your shown problem solving skills and experience making decisions based on hard and soft data
Your commitment to a better way of working through greater collaboration and breaking down of silos creating a high performing team
Your ability to effectively collaborate to build alliances and relationships across the broader Fidelity organization
The Value You Deliver
Identifying and driving technology roadmap solutions across all aspects of data acquisition, ingestion, data movement, data modelling, storage and usage for analytic consumption
Being responsible for the end-to-end management of driving a roadmap, aligning priorities, conveying vision and articulating end-state usage and value
Partnering and influencing across Sales and Marketing functions and other Tribes and Centers of Excellence (Market Enablement, CRM, Performance Enablement, AI, Visualization)
Delivering on Product Owner/Squad Leader responsibilities such as translating business goals into strategy and approach, prioritize backlogs and sprints, defining the business process and critical metrics, and owning vendor relationships
Defining squad based business value metrics and drive each sprint to deliver these outcomes
Supporting and enabling the squad to get its work done - regularly engaging with the squad to offer feedback on work-in-progress, clarify requirements and answer questions



Company Overview


At Fidelity, we are focused on making our financial expertise broadly accessible and effective in helping people live the lives they want. We are a privately held company that places a high degree of value in creating and nurturing a work environment that attracts the best talent and reflects our commitment to our associates. We are proud of our diverse and inclusive workplace where we respect and value our associate for their unique perspectives and experiences. For information about working at Fidelity, visit FidelityCareers.com.


Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer.

Description




If you are a passionate practitioner of machine learning and artificial intelligence who does not shy away from using the latest tools and technology in the cloud, to push the boundaries of model building targeting the best in class industry-leading capabilities, this is the right job for you.




You are comfortable imagining a world where it takes six days or less versus six months to build, train, test, iterate, explain and deploy models into production working with both internal and external stakeholders. You take immense pride in your everyday work but have zero egos taking feedback and bringing teammates along the journey and you can balance model accuracy with human intuition and common sense.




Primary responsibilities include:
Driving transformation using machine learning, either working individually or in small groups.
Rolling up your sleeves and enabling the model building process from end-to-end managing stakeholders, presenting the results and helping the team grow in an agile organization.
Qualifications




Required Skills/Experience:
4 or more years of experience working in a data environment
At least 2 years of experience in Python, Scala or R
Demonstrated quick learner, highly analytical with excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication and storytelling skills
Enjoys solving challenging problems in a fast-paced environment and participating in Kaggle competitions
Proven experience working on multiple projects involving programming and building predictive models using R or Python
Experience building and deploying machine learning algorithms such as Random Forest, Gradient Boosting and Neural Networks into production
Experience supporting multiple projects using Natural Language Processing and Text Analytics
Experience working in distributed computing technology such as HDFS, Spark MLib, and Mapreduce
Hand on experience with Amazon AWS machine learning technologies such as Amazon SageMaker, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Textract
Experience working with relational databases and data warehouse such as Amazon Redshift
Education, Certifications, and Other Professional Credentials:
Bachelors or Masters in computer science and or in a field such as statistics, mathematics, econometrics from a top-tier institution with a strong academic track record
Certifications in AWS and machine learning are preferred
Hours & Work Schedule




Hours per Week: 40




Work Schedule: Monday through Friday

Description
The Senior Data Analyst is adept at working with business and systems partners to translate project / business requirements reports, data sets, data services and data interfaces.


In this role you will apply a strong knowledge of banking / financial services / data analytics domain combined with hands-on data analysis skills and critical thinking. You should be able to analyze data, summarize critical information, identify data/process gaps and provide recommendation to close data/process gaps in collaboration with business partners and teams within EDO.


Primary responsibilities include:
Independently conducting research, analysis, data discovery, discovering and evaluating options for data solutions. Providing recommendations to team and project leads on bringing business requirements to a proposed design/ data solution.
Producing consistent, accurate and complete data requirements and definitions for complex projects.
Working with business users and others to understand their business functions and processes in order to help them define business intelligence, analytic and reporting requirements.
Assisting in assessing and building data and metadata requirements for systems that are complete and unambiguous.
Using statistical methods and tests to analyze data and generate useful data sets and reports.
Working with management team and other leads to prioritize needs for business segments.
Identifying and recommending new, innovative ways to streamline data-centric processes.
Using data to create models that depict trends in the customer base or the consumer population, or within a specified segment or business processing area.
Working with departmental managers to outline data needs for analytical, reporting and data integration projects.
Defining and building data sets to be used by offshore and other integration testing teams for validation
Assisting in third party data acquisition, vendor / data capability evaluations
Partnering with internal data governance teams to master existing and new 3rd party data.

Qualifications
Required Skills/Experience:
Experience conducting data discovery and analysis work with one or more commonly-used business intelligence tools, such as Tableau, SAS, Oracle, Cognos, Microsoft, etc.
Hands-on skills working with SQL and /or other data querying / wrangling tools.
Experience working with database management systems (Oracle, MS-SQL, DB2, etc).
3 or more years of data mining/data discovery experience/data reconciliation/business analysis validation.
10 or more years of experience in a data analyst / data analytics / business analytics role
Ability to collaborate effectively, take initiative and work as part of an Agile team
Strong attention to detail
Experience applying business acumen to data analysis and data
Preferred Skills/Experience:
Experience in the financial services industry, especially banking.
SAS programming or R/Python or Alteryx for data wrangling.
Data design or data management experience is a plus.
Business Intelligence/Reporting development experience using tools such as Tableau, Cognos
Cross-functional experience in finance, credit risk desirable
Some statistical testing / multivariate data analysis desirable
Experience / knowledge of third party data used for B2B Marketing and Sales such as D and B.
Educational, Certifications and/or Other Professional Credentials:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Business
Hours & Work Schedule


Hours per Week: 40
Work Schedule: Monday through Friday 8:30AM - 5:00PM

The team provides cross asset class support and expertise tobusiness partners across the firm, including Proposal Services, Sales,Relationship Management, Consultant Relations, and Investment Professionals.


The Expertise You Have

Bachelor's degree (major in Finance, Economics, or Business).

Description
We’re developing the next generation of data scientists

The banking industry is evolving rapidly and dramatically, driven by customer demands for great experiences, simple solutions, and innovative ideas. Join us as we look to enhance the customer and colleague experience by harnessing the power of data and advanced analytics.

Experience during the program

NOTE: THIS INTERNSHIP PROGRAM BEGINS IN EARLY JUNE 2020

The Data Scientist Intern is responsible for assembling, managing, and investigating data to be used for various analytical purposes including developing insights, optimizing investment spend, identifying new marketing opportunities, and providing strategic direction to senior management. This full-time position allows a student to work within a big data business environment and leverage that environment to support development of models, insights, and data intelligence that drive retention/growth programs and optimization of a variety of bank functions, including origination, servicing and account management, operations, underwriting, risk, etc.

Please note: this internship will be based in Johnston, RI.


Tasks can include:
Investigating/mining new data streams to assess utility and ability to connect to existing environment
Maintaining and executing programs to merge/assemble data for analytic uses
Researching growing market trends and mine the Citizens data intelligence to develop new insights that can guide the strategic direction of the Citizens Bank lines of business
Documenting and communicating technical/analytic results for a non-technical audience


Qualifications
What you’ll need to apply
Bachelor’s Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Applied Math, Data Analytics or related
Pursuing a Masters degree from Brown University with an expected graduation date of December 2020 or May 2021
Statistical programming experience with variety of data/analytic software languages/tools (e.g., SQL, SAS, R, Splus, etc.)
Ability to work in a team environment and collaborate with colleagues who have a background in statistics, database development/maintenance, and information technology
Knowledge of a variety of statistical concepts and procedures, such as: generalized linear models, experimental design, stochastic processes, response surface methodology, and statistical graphics
Ability to understand, prepare, and present statistical results
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong programming skills and ability to utilize a variety of data/analytic software languages/tools (e.g., SQL, SAS, R, etc.)
Full-time 40 hours/week in summer and breaks; flexible during school year
Key Success Factors:
Eagerness to learn about a big data environment within a large, retail bank


Why Work for Us
At Citizens, you'll find a customer-centric culture built around helping our customers and giving back to our local communities. When you join our team, you are part of a supportive and collaborative workforce, with access to training and tools to accelerate your potential and maximize your career growth.

Description
The Senior Data Analyst is adept at working with business and systems partners to translate project / business requirements reports, data sets, data services and data interfaces.


In this role you will apply a strong knowledge of banking / financial services / data analytics domain combined with hands-on data analysis skills and critical thinking. You should be able to analyze data, summarize critical information, identify data/process gaps and provide recommendation to close data/process gaps in collaboration with business partners and teams within EDO.


Primary responsibilities include:
Independently conducting research, analysis, data discovery, discovering and evaluating options for data solutions. Providing recommendations to team and project leads on bringing business requirements to a proposed design/ data solution.
Producing consistent, accurate and complete data requirements and definitions for complex projects.
Working with business users and others to understand their business functions and processes in order to help them define business intelligence, analytic and reporting requirements.
Assisting in assessing and building data and metadata requirements for systems that are complete and unambiguous.
Using statistical methods and tests to analyze data and generate useful data sets and reports.
Working with management team and other leads to prioritize needs for business segments.
Identifying and recommending new, innovative ways to streamline data-centric processes.
Using data to create models that depict trends in the customer base or the consumer population, or within a specified segment or business processing area.
Working with departmental managers to outline data needs for analytical, reporting and data integration projects.
Defining and building data sets to be used by offshore and other integration testing teams for validation
Assisting in third party data acquisition, vendor / data capability evaluations
Partnering with internal data governance teams to master existing and new 3rd party data.

Qualifications
Required Skills/Experience:
Experience conducting data discovery and analysis work with one or more commonly-used business intelligence tools, such as Tableau, SAS, Oracle, Cognos, Microsoft, etc.
Hands-on skills working with SQL and /or other data querying / wrangling tools.
Experience working with database management systems (Oracle, MS-SQL, DB2, etc).
3 or more years of data mining/data discovery experience/data reconciliation/business analysis validation.
10 or more years of experience in a data analyst / data analytics / business analytics role
Ability to collaborate effectively, take initiative and work as part of an Agile team
Strong attention to detail
Experience applying business acumen to data analysis and data
Preferred Skills/Experience:
Experience in the financial services industry, especially banking.
SAS programming or R/Python or Alteryx for data wrangling.
Data design or data management experience is a plus.
Business Intelligence/Reporting development experience using tools such as Tableau, Cognos
Cross-functional experience in finance, credit risk desirable
Some statistical testing / multivariate data analysis desirable
Experience / knowledge of third party data used for B2B Marketing and Sales such as D and B.
Educational, Certifications and/or Other Professional Credentials:
Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Statistics or Business
Hours & Work Schedule


Hours per Week: 40
Work Schedule: Monday through Friday 8:30AM - 5:00PM
